column2: U.S. FCC pauses clock on Comcast-TWC
column3: AT&T-DirecTV; merger reviews WASHINGTON
column4: March 13 The U.S. Federal Communications Commission on Friday paused its informal 180-day countdown to deciding the fate of two mergers - Comcast Corp's  with Time Warner Cable Inc and AT&T; Inc's  with DirecTV.

column2: Delphi plans coast-to-coast demo of its self-driving car DETROIT
column3: March 13 Delphi Automotive PLC  aims to demonstrate its growing prowess in self-driving cars with what it bills as the "longest automated drive ever attempted in North America" - a 3
column4: 500-mile coast-to-coast excursion in a specially rigged Audi SQ5 that will mostly drive itself.

column2: DuPont rejects four Peltz nominees March 13 DuPont rejected hedge fund Trian's proposal of four nominees
column3: according to a letter to activist investor Nelson Peltz from the company's board on Friday.

column2: EQT and Goldman Sachs sell 19 pct of ISS for $1 blnCORRECTED-UPDATE 1-EQT and Goldman Sachs sell 19 pct of ISS for $1 bln COPENHAGEN
